author: Katrina Beavan
description: The build for a green hydrogen manufacturing hub is now underway in central Queensland, as Andrew Forrest confirms a separate $3 billion investment in a solar, wind and battery farm, in the same region.
headline: Andrew Forrest begins work on green hydrogen hub, confirms $3b for renewables farm

author: Ben Millington
description: The early closure of coal-fired power stations is expected to prevent deaths, reduce asthma attacks, and save hundreds of millions of dollars in health costs.
headline: 'The air will be cleaner the next day': The health benefits of closing Australia's coal-fired power stations

author: Lauren Roberts
catergories: ["Indigenous (Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander)","COVID-19","Vaccines and Immunity","State and Territory Parliament","Community and Society"]
description: The NT's peak Aboriginal health body is calling for "urgent action" to boost remote vaccination rates — especially in Central Australia and the Barkly region — before the NT continues to wind back public health measures.
headline: As NT's restrictions ease, experts say its 'critical' to improve remote booster rates

author: Sally Rafferty
description: As consumers look at alternatives to cut down their grocery bills, dieticians warn cutting out meat is not a decision that should be made lightly.
headline: Can't afford meat? Experts warn cutting out meat could be dangerous

author: Peta Fuller
description: Here's your TL;DR for this morning's news.
headline: The Loop: Putin puts nuclear forces on high alert, flood death toll rises, and SNL gets serious

author: Kath Sullivan
description: Federal Labor hints it will seek to tear up a major agreement about how water could be recovered for the environment across the Murray-Darling Basin if it wins this year's election.
headline: Opposition hints at changes, but will 'uphold the letter and spirit' of Murray-Darling Basin Plan

author: Steve Cannane
description: Anastasia Rodina is one of the thousands of young Russians who have taken to the streets to protest against Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine. But in defying the might of the Kremlin, many risk their safety, freedom and future.
headline: 'You can be beaten by policemen': The Russian protesters willing to pay a hefty price to defy Putin's war

author: Michael Janda and Peter Ryan
description: Russia is being dealt more financial blows, with Australian billionaire Andrew Forrest pulling back on hydrogen investments there, while oil giant BP and Norway's sovereign wealth fund are also divesting from the country.
headline: Forrest pulls back on Russian investments, while BP may take $US25 billion hit to exit the country

author: null
description: After being criticised for their initial move to ban games in Russia, FIFA and UEFA unite to suspend Russia from international football, all but ruling them out of the men's World Cup.
headline: FIFA, UEFA suspend Russian teams from international football after initial half-measure

author: Sue Lannin
description: Wall Street falls in volatile trade amid new financial sanctions on Russia, which have seen the country's central bank more than double its key interest rate overnight.
headline: Russia doubles interest rates as markets tumble amid financial sanctions
